hanzi-su-wiki:
鳴

Значения

Издавать звуки (о животных); звучать, раздаваться

Мнемоника

Чириканье 口 птиц 鳥.

Варианты

鸣
purpleculture_pinyin:
míng
to cry (of birds, animals and insects); to make a sound; to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
плакать (птиц, зверей и насекомых); издавать звук; озвучивать (свою благодарность, обиду и т. д.)

heisig_chinese_memo: A twitter is quite simply a sound that comes from the mouth of birds.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: chirp, cry, bark, sound, ring, echo, honk
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: ЛАЯ, крик, кора, звук, кольцо, эхо, гудок
koohiiStory1: A chirp is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.
koohiiStory2: This kanji is not limited to the chirp of a bird, but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its mouth (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals: Meeow! Woof! Mooo! Cuack!!! (Maybe the bird has Kirby powers and obtains the abilities of the animals it eats).
jp_example_words:
共鳴(きょうめい): resonance, sympathy
怒鳴る(どなる): to shout, to yell
悲鳴(ひめい): shriek, scream
鳴らす(ならす): ring, sound, chime, beat
鳴る(なる): sound, ring
鳴く(なく): bark, purr, chirp, make sound (animal)
jp_readingExamples: 鳴く (な.く), 鳴らす (な.らす), 鳴る (な.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When a bird opens its mouth, you’re most likely to hear a chirp. This is how birds communicate. They open their mouths and let out a series of chirps. Chirp chirp chirp!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself out in the wilderness on a sunny spring day. The weather is perfect and the scenery is beautiful. The only sound you can hear is the chirp of birds throughout the woods around you. It’s very peaceful.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The best place to experience the chirp chirping of birds is when you’re out in nature (な). You’re not going to hear birds chirping in a crowded city, so you need to get out into nature to fully experience the birds and their chirps.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Nature is a great place to clear your mind and relax. Picture yourself in nature’s wilderness once again. The sun on your face, the wind in your hair, the grass beneath your feet, and the chirps of birds in the air. It’s quite nice.
Ru_Russian: чирикать, сверчать, кричать по-звериному, петь по-птичьи
Ru_Meaning: chirp, cry, bark, sound, ring, echo, honk
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 嗚 (ああ、ウ、オ звук плача, звук "А"). Сравни: 泣 (なく、キュウ плакать).
Ru_trainchinese: míng: (глаг) (о птицах, животных или насекомых) петь, щебетать, кричать, стрекотать; издавать звук, звенеть; выражать, высказывать (точку зрения, чувства)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the bird's (鳥) mouth (口) chirps
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When sounds come out of a bird's mouth it's typically a twitter.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " sing " in the oracle bone inscriptions starts from " mouth ", " chicken " or " bird ", with its beaks open upwards (the difference is obvious from " Wei ", see " Wei ").

The oracle bone inscriptions are mostly " chicken " pictograms (Luo Zhenyu, Shang Chengzuo). This is particularly noticeable in those with a crown, and those with a crown often have a three-stroke long tail, and the overall shape is like a rooster's upturned beak croaking. Luo Zhenyu believes that "the chicken sings in the morning.... It sings in time. By extension, it is the sing of birds." Luo and Shang's comments can be consulted. Oracle also has fonts not from " chicken " but from " bird ". If the initial meaning of the word "Ming" is " chicken " and " Bird " is the extended meaning, then " chicken " or " bird " can be used.

Shang Jin Wencheng bones in " chicken -shaped" Honking (see Ming goblet). Zhou Jinwen basically inherited the shape and structure of the oracle bones, from the mouth to the bird shape, and the bird shape all raised its first beak to make a call. It is said that the inscriptions of Zhou's inscriptions are " wu " (the general interpretation of the inscriptions in inscriptions).

Inscriptions are used as names (Yao Xiaosui). In addition to being used as the clan emblem (see Mingqi), the bronze inscriptions are also used as sounds, especially the bells, such as the bell of the survivor of the king and grandson: "Yuanming Kongfu"

"Said Wen": "Song, the sound of birds. From the bird to the mouth."
humanum_short_description_en: The word " sing " in the oracle bone inscription starts from " mouth ", " chicken " or " bird ", with its beaks open and upwards (the difference is obvious from " wei ", see "唯"), the original meaning is bird song.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文「鳴」字從「口」從「雞」或從「鳥」，其喙多張開向上（與「唯」區別明顯，參見「唯」），本義是雀鳥鳴叫。

　　甲骨文多作「雞」之象形（羅振玉、商承祚），這一點在那些有冠的字形尤其顯著，而有冠的又常有三劃長尾，整體形狀象公雞仰首張喙鳴叫之形。羅振玉認為「雞司晨…。應時而鳴。引申而為凡鳥之鳴。」羅、商之說可參。甲骨文亦有字形不從「雞」而從「鳥」。若鳴字初義為雞鳴，鳥鳴為引申義，那麼從「雞」或從「鳥」則可通。

　　商代金文承甲骨中「雞」鳴之字形（見鳴觶）。周金文基本上承甲骨之形構，從口從鳥形，而鳥形皆仰首張喙作鳴叫狀。一說周金文所從實即「烏」（金文形義通解），可參。

　　卜辭用為人名（姚孝遂）。金文除用作氏族徽號（見鳴觶）外，亦用為聲響，特指鐘聲，如王孫遺者鐘︰「元鳴孔諻。」

　　《說文》：「鳴，鳥聲也。從鳥從口。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文「鳴」字從「口」從「雞」或從「鳥」，其喙多張開向上（與「唯」區別明顯，參見「唯」），本義是雀鳥鳴叫。

甲骨文「 鳴 」字從「 口 」從「 雞 」或從「 鳥 」，其喙多張開向上（與「 唯 」區別明顯，參見「 唯 」），本義是雀鳥鳴叫。 甲骨文多作「 雞 」之象形（羅振玉、商承祚），這一點在那些有冠的字形尤其顯著，而有冠的又常有三劃長尾，整體形狀象公雞仰首張喙鳴叫之形。羅振玉認為「雞司晨…。應時而鳴。引申而為凡鳥之鳴。」羅、商之說可參。甲骨文亦有字形不從「 雞 」而從「 鳥 」。若鳴字初義為雞鳴，鳥鳴為引申義，那麼從「 雞 」或從「 鳥 」則可通。 商代金文承甲骨中「 雞 」鳴之字形（見鳴觶）。周金文基本上承甲骨之形構，從口從鳥形，而鳥形皆仰首張喙作鳴叫狀。一說周金文所從實即「 烏 」（金文形義通解），可參。 卜辭用為人名（姚孝遂）。金文除用作氏族徽號（見鳴觶）外，亦用為聲響，特指鐘聲，如王孫遺者鐘︰「元鳴孔諻。」 《說文》：「鳴，鳥聲也。從鳥從口。」
The word " sing" in the oracle bone inscriptions starts from " mouth", " chicken" or " bird", with its beaks open upwards (the difference is obvious from " Wei", see " Wei"). The oracle bone inscriptions are mostly " chicken" pictograms (Luo Zhenyu, Shang Chengzuo). This is particularly noticeable in those with a crown, and those with a crown often have a three-stroke long tail, and the overall shape is like a rooster's upturned beak croaking. Luo Zhenyu believes that "the chicken sings in the morning.... It sings in time. By extension, it is the sing of birds." Luo and Shang's comments can be consulted. Oracle also has fonts not from " chicken" but from " bird". If the initial meaning of the word "Ming" is " chicken" and " Bird" is the extended meaning, then " chicken" or " bird" can be used. Shang Jin Wencheng bones in " chicken -shaped" Honking (see Ming goblet). Zhou Jinwen basically inherited the shape and structure of the oracle bones, from the mouth to the bird shape, and the bird shape all raised its first beak to make a call. It is said that the inscriptions of Zhou's inscriptions are " wu" (the general interpretation of the inscriptions in inscriptions). Inscriptions are used as names (Yao Xiaosui). In addition to being used as the clan emblem (see Mingqi), the bronze inscriptions are also used as sounds, especially the bells, such as the bell of the survivor of the king and grandson: "Yuanming Kongfu" "Said Wen": "Song, the sound of birds. From the bird to the mouth."

鳴字的基本解释

鳴
míng
见“鸣”。

鳴字的汉语字典释义

[①]［míng］
［《廣韻》武兵切，平庚，明。］
“鸣1”的繁体字。
(1)鸟兽昆虫叫。
(2)发出声响。
(3)使物发声。
(4)犹震惊，惊动。
(5)呼唤。
(6)呼吁。
(7)表示申告。参见“鳴官”。
(8)言说；称说。
(9)发表（意见）；抒发（感情）。
(10)著称，闻名。
(11)声音高响。
(12)通“明”。

鳴字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鳴； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1482第18
【唐韻】武兵切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】眉兵切，?音明。【說文】鳥聲也。【玉篇】聲相命也，嘷也。【詩·大雅】鳳凰鳴矣，于彼高岡。又獸亦曰鳴。【易·說卦傳】其於馬也爲善鳴。又【增韻】凡出聲皆曰鳴。【禮·學記】叩之以小，則小鳴。叩之以大，則大鳴。【莊子·德充符】子以堅白鳴。又鳥名。【山海經】弇州山有五彩之鳥，仰天鳴，名曰鳴鳥。【書·召誥】我則鳴鳥不聞。【音義】馬云：鳴鳥，謂鳳凰也。又姓。出【姓苑】。又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?眉病切，音命。鳥相呼也。【馬融·長笛賦】山雞晨羣，野雉朝雊。求偶鳴子，悲號長嘯。【註】鳴，命也。【曹植詩】鳴儔嘯匹侶。又叶謨郞切，音芒。【前漢·郊祀歌】寒暑不忒況皇章，展詩應律鋗玉鳴。函宮吐角激徵淸，發梁揚羽申以商。【張華·俠曲】孟嘗東出關，濟身由雞鳴。信陵西反魏，秦人?其彊。

考證：〔【禮·樂記】叩之以小，則小鳴。叩之以大，則大鳴。〕　謹照原書樂記改學記。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［míng］
["Guangyun" Wu Bingqie, Ping Geng, Ming. ]
Traditional characters for "鸣1".
(1) Birds, animals and insects call.
(2) Make a sound.
(3) Make things sound.
(4) Still shocked and alarmed.
(5) Call.
(6) Appeal.
(7) Represents a declaration. See "Ming Guan".
(8) Speaking; Speaking.
(9) Express (opinions); express (feelings).
(10) Famous and famous.
(11) The sound is loud.
(12) Clear "Ming".

Name meaning

míng
вм. 鸣
Radicals: 口, 鳥  (mouth, bird)
Meaning Mnemonic
When a bird opens its mouth, you’re most likely to hear a chirp. This is how birds communicate. They open their mouths and let out a series of chirps. Chirp chirp chirp!
Imagine yourself out in the wilderness on a sunny spring day. The weather is perfect and the scenery is beautiful. The only sound you can hear is the chirp of birds throughout the woods around you. It’s very peaceful.
Reading Mnemonic
The best place to experience the chirp chirping of birds is when you’re out in nature (な). You’re not going to hear birds chirping in a crowded city, so you need to get out into nature to fully experience the birds and their chirps.
Nature is a great place to clear your mind and relax. Picture yourself in nature’s wilderness once again. The sun on your face, the wind in your hair, the grass beneath your feet, and the chirps of birds in the air. It’s quite nice.

Examples: 鳴く (な.く), 鳴らす (な.らす), 鳴る (な.る)
口 (рот), 杰, 鳥 (птица)
